cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the southeast Louisiana coast, then expected to turn westward and slide along the Louisiana shoreline through Tuesday night
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana near the mouth of the Mississippi River

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning, Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Intracoastal City LA to the MS/AL border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans; Storm Surge Warning from Morgan City LA to Ocean Springs MS including Lake Borgne
weather_observation.impacted_coast: southeast and south-central Louisiana coast and adjacent north-central Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are likely Monday afternoon and evening with a 51% cumulative chance of 34-kt winds and 12% chance of 50-kt gusts at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water levels of 2–4 ft above ground are possible along the lower Mississippi River and adjacent lakes, including areas immediately surrounding the Port of South Louisiana.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with locally higher totals up to 10 inches could produce flash and urban flooding in the port vicinity Monday–Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and dangerous rip currents on the lower Mississippi River approaches; isolated tornadoes possible Monday.
